request_pathways.name: Fax to Iowa Clinic Support Services (515-875-9600)
Mail to The Iowa Clinic Support Services, 6800 Lake Dr., Ste 270, West Des Moines, IA 50266

forms.document_type: ROI authorization form (older version dated October 2012, with dedicated sensitive-information page)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: The Iowa Clinic routes patient self-requests through a Swellbox/Datavant online wizard, with a separate SmartRequest portal for third-party organizations; no downloadable PDF form is currently offered.

red_flags: Historical PDF forms request Social Security Number, which is unnecessary for records release
Blanket liability waiver for electronic transmission shifts all risk of misdirected fax/email to the patient
bright_spots: Fully transitioned to online portal-based workflow via Swellbox/Datavant, eliminating print-and-fax cycle
Website clearly differentiates patient self-requests from third-party release with separate platforms
Historical form includes 'Request by patient' as an explicit purpose option acknowledging patient-initiated access
Concise single-page form design (form-1) minimizes patient burden

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic navigation — the medical records page is accessible under For Patients > Payment & Billing and clearly directs patients to the Swellbox request wizard, though no downloadable PDF forms exist on the current site.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital workflow — the current Swellbox online portal provides a fully digital submission path, but the only downloadable form documents (historical PDFs) have zero fillable fields and would require print-and-handwrite; fax was available as electronic submission.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Adequate but with notable problems — the historical form-1 has a logical single-page layout with reasonable record-type options, but language is semi-legal, there are no explicit instructions, and SSN is unnecessarily collected.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 4: Patient access is clearly accommodated — the current website routes patient self-requests to a dedicated Swellbox wizard separate from third-party channels, though the historical PDF forms were generic ROI authorization forms not designed specifically for patient access.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing materially impeding — cost-based fee language is compliant, no notarization required, revocation rights stated; the SSN collection and blanket liability waiver are the only notable concerns.

overall.summary: The Iowa Clinic earns a B by fully transitioning to online portal-based records requests with clear patient/third-party pathway differentiation, though the historical PDF forms lacked fillable fields, collected SSN unnecessarily, and used semi-legal language.
